decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The works to which this consent relates, must be begun not later than the expiration of five years beginning with the date of this consent.
Condition : 2 - All new internal and external works, including works of making good, shall match the original work in both type, colour and dimensions of materials and in detailed execution.

Condition : 3 - A schedule for all new windows, doors and at scale 1:20 be submitted and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authoriy before the commence of works and the approved details shall be implemented and maintained thereafter.

Condition : 4 - A method statement for making good all external walls exposed after demolition be submitted and a sample agreed on site and in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the commence of works and the approved details shall be implemented and maintained thereafter.

Condition : 5 - Full details of the following:
   a) structural section, decorative details and glazing to the conwervatory
   b) details on any new repointing and brickwork repairs
   c) a schedule of repairs and reinstatement to include planting of semi-circular garden        feature,
ahall ne submitted and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authoriy before the commencement of works and the approved details shall be implemented and maintained thereafter.

Condition : 6 - Full details with sections and method statements of repair work to internal features listed below:
   a) plaster work,  b) cornices,  C) architrave,  d) skirting,  e) doors,  f) shutters,  g) brackets,  h) ceiling roses,  i) lincrusta/anaglypta j) decorative bolections, k) fireplaces and surrounds,  l) parquet flooring,  m)  lantern light, n) works to the veranda o) dado,  p)floorboards, and q) panelling
shall be submitted and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the commencement of works and the approved details shall be implemented and maintained thereafter.

Condition : 7 - Sample panels of brickwork showing the proposed colour, texture, face-bond na pointing shall be provided on site and approved by  the Local Planning Authority before the works anre commenced and the ample panels shatt be retained on site until the work is completed and has been approved.
Condition : 8 - A sample roof tile showing the proposed colour anf texture shall be provided on site and approved in writin by the Local Planning Authority before the commence of works.
Condition : 9 - All extenal joinery shall be of painted timber.

Condition : 10 - No development shall take place until the external apperarnce of the annex building, the courtyard building and the conservatory have been agreed and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 11 - A scheme of phasing of development shall be submitted and approved by The Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 12 - Structural Engineers drawings, indicating the intended method of ensuring the stability of the fabric to be retained throughout the period of demolition and reconstruction, shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 13 - A scheme scheduling the precautions to be taken to secure and protect the interior elements against accidental loss or damage during the building work shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  No elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the drawings approved.

Condition : 14 - The position, type and mannerof installation of all new and relocted services and related fittings shall be specified in writing in advance of any work being crried out, and the prior approval or the Local Planning Authority must be obtained wherever these installations are to be visible or where ducts or other methods of concealment are propesed.
Condition : 15 - No plumbing or pipes, other than rainwater pipes, shall be fixed on the external faces of the building unless shown on the approved drawings.
Condition : 16 - The position, type and manner of installation of all new partitions and fitting-out within the Listed Bullding shal be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 17 - No devolopment shall take place until there has been submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment erected.

Condition : 18 - No development shall take place until full details of both the hard and soft landscaping works around the vicinity of the Listed Building have been sunmitte dans approved by the Local Planning Authoriy

Condition : 19 - A section to show the area between the listed structures and the proposed annex to include how the subterraneana rea will be constructed, finished, the design of the rooflights and a method statement to show how the lawned areas will be sustained shall be submitted and approved be the Local Planning Authority

Condition : 20 - Full details of the new courtyard structure to include the glazed sections, glazing and fixings shall be agreed on site and submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the commence of works.

Condition : 21 - The deveolper shall afford accessat all reasonable times to any archaelolgist nominated by the Local Planning Authority, and shall allow him/her to observe the excavations and record items of interest and finds.
description: Demolition of bungalow, single storey flank and chimney stack.  Erection of 2 and 3 storey extension, and change of use from vacant building to provide 84 bedroomed hotel and associated parking, landscaping and leisure facilities.
